#Text=Wikinews interviews organiser of New Zealand 's Rock2Wgtn festival Phil Sprey
#Text=Wednesday , March 26 , 2008
#Text=Across Easter weekend
#Text=Wellington , New Zealand was host to Rock2Wgtn , an international two-day hard rock festival .
#Text=Large crowds showed up at Westpac Stadium to see the various acts .
#Text=The world has never seen an event of this kind before .
#Text=Day one featured three theatrical acts .
#Text=Finnish band Lordi , known for their monster costumes , opened the night .

#Text=They were followed by the US shock rocker Alice Cooper , whose themed set included the horror theatrics regularly associated with him and a hanging stunt he recently restarted after a gallows collapse nearly killed him two decades ago .
#Text=The night was headlined by the distinctively costumed band KISS , complete with their famed black-and-white makeup .
#Text=The first major act on the stage on day two was the American hard rock/ glam metal band Poison .
#Text=After Poison , British act Whitesnake took to the stage and performed their set to the crowd .
#Text=British-born American rocker Ozzy Osbourne , who , as well as a solo career , fronts the world-famous Black Sabbath , was the second night 's headline act .
#Text=The festival 's entertainment did not stop at the six main acts .
#Text=There was also support performances from three New Zealand bands - The Symphony of Screams , The Valves and Sonic Altar .
#Text=Their sets were accompanied by a special effects package from award-winning studio Weta Workshops , who are known for their work on movies such as The Lord of the Rings film trilogy .
#Text=This came in the form of ' Drusila the Dragon ' , which rose up to a height of six foot and wigspan and moved for the audience , shining lasers from its eyes and breathing red smoke .
#Text=Flame Fire Productions were hired to put on a fire show featuring several dancers alongside the performers .
#Text=Also performing were six local guitarists and a group of ' zombie ' cheerleaders .
#Text=Despite the crowds that flocked to the event , however , it has recently become apparent that financial trouble has hit the festival .
#Text=Although figures remain to be confirmed , an estimated NZ$ 750,000 has been lost .
#Text=Wikinews secured an exclusive interview with Phil Sprey of Capital C Concerts , who organised the festival .
#Text=The entire interview is now available below .
#Text=Interview
#Text=What initially gave you the idea to stage New Zealand 's first rock festival ?

#Text=Easter in Wellington is normally a quieter place and as we are resident here we were working to not only present a phenomenal experience but to drive short range international tourism and domestic tourism .
#Text=To do this we needed an impressive line-up and a format that was as much theatrical as it was festival .
#Text=On a company level we were demonstrating that NZ has the ability to stage big events and have the planning , equipment services etc to deliver .
#Text=We did this well beyond expectation and every artist management was more than satisfied with the production .
#Text=We also wanted to brand our name to agents and management around the world - we have done this as well .
